# Harmonic B Scale (Mode: Locrian #6, Shape: C)

### Brief Description
The Harmonic B Scale, also known as the Locrian #6 scale, is a seven-note scale that originates from the 7th degree of the A Harmonic Minor scale. It is characterized by its unique intervals and can be used to create an exotic and mysterious sound in music compositions.

### Notes and Intervals
- B (Root)
- C (Minor 2nd)
- D (Minor 3rd)
- E (Perfect 4th)
- F (Diminished 5th)
- G# (Major 6th)
- A# (Major 7th)

### Musical Flavor and Genre
The Harmonic B Scale, being a mode of the Locrian scale with an added major 6th degree, has a dissonant and unsettled quality due to the tritone interval between the root and diminished 5th. It often finds its place in jazz, fusion, and progressive rock music, adding a touch of intrigue and tension to compositions.
